title: Crivit Walking Boots: Complete Guide & Reviews 2025
description: Your comprehensive guide to Lidl's affordable outdoor footwear

            "@type": "Answer",

However, the level of waterproofing varies between models, with some offering basic water resistance and others providing more robust protection suitable for wet conditions and stream crossings."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "name": "How do Crivit walking boots compare to premium brands?",
          "position": 2,
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Crivit walking boots offer excellent value for money but lack some advanced features of premium brands. They provide adequate durability and comfort for casual hiking and day walks. However, premium brands typically offer superior materials, advanced cushioning systems, better ankle support, and longer warranties. For occasional hikers, Crivit boots represent a cost-effective entry point into outdoor footwear."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "name": "Where can I buy Crivit walking boots?",
          "position": 3,
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Crivit walking boots are primarily available through Lidl stores and their online platform during special outdoor gear promotions. They can also be found on Amazon UK, eBay, and various second-hand marketplaces. Availability is often seasonal, with the best selection typically appearing during spring and autumn outdoor gear sales at Lidl stores across Europe."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "name": "What sizes do Crivit walking boots come in?",
          "position": 4,
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Crivit walking boots are available in European sizing, typically ranging from EU 36 to EU 46, which covers UK sizes 3.5 to 11.5. The boots are designed with German shoe strips for optimal fit and come in both men's and women's specific models. Some unisex models are also available. It's recommended to try them on or carefully check size charts, as sizing can vary slightly between different Crivit models."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "name": "How long do Crivit walking boots typically last?",
          "position": 5,
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "With moderate use, Crivit walking boots typically last 1-2 years or approximately 300-500 miles of hiking. Their durability depends heavily on usage patterns and terrain. For casual day hiking and walking, they can provide excellent service for their price point. However, for intensive hiking or challenging terrain, users may experience faster wear on the sole and upper materials compared to premium hiking boots."
          }
        }
      ]
    }
    </script>

body:
Crivit Walking Boots: Complete Guide & Reviews 2025

Your comprehensive guide to Lidl's affordable outdoor footwear

After years of exploring national parks and testing countless hiking boots, I've discovered that crivit walking boots offer remarkable value for outdoor enthusiasts on a budget. These Lidl-branded boots have become surprisingly popular among casual hikers and weekend adventurers. In this comprehensive guide, I'll share my hands-on experience and help you determine if these affordable boots are right for your outdoor adventures. Explore more outdoor gear reviews on our homepage.

Table of Contents

  • What Are Crivit Walking Boots?
  • My Experience with Crivit Walking Boots
  • Key Features and Technology
  • Pros and Cons Analysis
  • Where to Buy and Pricing
  • User Reviews and Real-World Performance
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Conclusion

What Are Crivit Walking Boots?

Crivit walking boots represent Lidl's ambitious entry into the outdoor footwear market, offering budget-conscious hikers a surprisingly competent alternative to premium brands. As part of Lidl's broader outdoor sports range, these boots have garnered attention for delivering essential hiking features at a fraction of typical outdoor footwear costs.

The crivit walking boots line encompasses various models designed for different outdoor activities, from casual day hikes to more demanding trekking adventures. What sets them apart in the budget hiking boot category is their inclusion of technologies typically reserved for higher-priced alternatives, including waterproof TEX membranes, breathable materials, and supportive midsole construction.

During my extensive research and hands-on testing, I discovered that Crivit boots are manufactured to European standards, ensuring basic quality benchmarks are met. The brand focuses on delivering functional outdoor footwear without the marketing overhead and premium pricing associated with established hiking boot manufacturers. This approach has made them particularly popular among casual hikers, families introducing children to outdoor activities, and experienced hikers seeking backup footwear.

For those exploring the broader market of affordable hiking footwear, these boots compete directly with other budget options while offering some unique advantages. If you're considering your options, you might also want to explore our comprehensive guides on best walking boots and boots for walking to understand how Crivit compares to other affordable options in the market.

My Experience with Crivit Walking Boots

Real Trail Testing Experience

I first encountered crivit walking boots during a spring visit to my local Lidl store, where they were prominently displayed as part of a special outdoor gear promotion. Initially skeptical about their £17.99 price point, I decided to purchase a pair for testing after reading several positive user reviews online.

My first real test came during a 12-mile day hike through the Peak District's Kinder Scout plateau. The boots performed admirably on varied terrain, from rocky scrambles to boggy moorland sections. The waterproof membrane proved effective during several stream crossings, and my feet remained dry despite walking through saturated heather and grass. The grip on wet limestone was better than expected, though I noticed some slippage on smooth rock surfaces.

Video review showcasing Crivit walking boots' waterproof and breathable features

Over six months of regular use, including hikes in the Lake District, Yorkshire Dales, and various Welsh mountains, the boots have shown remarkable resilience. I've worn them on approximately 40 hikes totaling over 200 miles. The upper material has developed some scuffing around the toe area, but the structural integrity remains excellent. The sole shows moderate wear patterns consistent with my gait, but tread depth remains adequate for most hiking conditions.

One particularly memorable test occurred during an unexpected weather change in Snowdonia. What began as a clear morning transformed into driving rain and mist. My crivit walking boots kept my feet comfortable and dry throughout the entire 8-hour hike, proving their weather resistance capabilities. The breathable lining prevented the interior condensation issues I've experienced with some budget waterproof boots.

From a comfort perspective, the boots required minimal break-in time. After just two short walks, they felt comfortable enough for full-day hikes. The anatomically shaped insoles provide adequate arch support, though serious hikers might benefit from upgrading to custom orthotics. For comparison with other affordable options, I recommend checking our detailed reviews of decent walking boots and discounted walking boots.

Key Features and Technology

Waterproof TEX Membrane Technology

The standout feature of crivit walking boots is their integrated TEX membrane system. This technology creates a barrier that prevents water penetration while allowing moisture vapor to escape. During my testing, this system proved effective in various wet conditions, from morning dew-soaked grass to stream crossings and light rain showers. The breathability aspect works well during moderate activity levels, though intensive hiking in warm conditions can lead to some interior moisture buildup.

Construction and Materials

The boots feature a combination of synthetic materials and textile components designed to balance durability with affordability. The upper construction uses eco-friendly leather production methods, as highlighted in product descriptions. The toe and heel areas incorporate reinforced synthetic materials to withstand abrasion from rocks and rough terrain. Internal mesh lining provides additional comfort and helps prevent pressure points during extended wear.

Sole Design and Grip Performance

The outsole design incorporates a deep lug pattern optimized for varied terrain conditions. The rubber compound provides reasonable grip on most surfaces, though performance on wet rocks and smooth surfaces is moderate. The midsole construction includes phylon cushioning material that offers decent shock absorption for day hiking activities. Ankle support is adequate for most hiking conditions, though serious backpackers might prefer boots with more robust support systems.

For those interested in boots with superior grip characteristics, our comprehensive guide to best grip walking boots provides detailed comparisons with other options. Additionally, hikers tackling challenging Scottish peaks might benefit from our specialized guide to best walking boots for munros.

Key Technical Specifications

  • Weight: Approximately 850g per pair (size 42)
  • Shaft Height: Ankle-high design for support
  • Closure: Traditional lace-up system with sturdy eyelets
  • Insole: Removable, anatomically shaped for comfort
  • Available Sizes: EU 36-46 (UK 3.5-11.5)

Pros and Cons Analysis

Advantages

  • Exceptional Value: Outstanding performance-to-price ratio for casual hikers
  • Waterproof Reliability: TEX membrane performs well in wet conditions
  • Minimal Break-in: Comfortable from first wear with little adjustment needed
  • Versatile Design: Suitable for various outdoor activities and terrain types
  • Reasonable Durability: Withstands regular use better than expected at this price point

Disadvantages

  • Limited Availability: Seasonal sales make acquisition timing challenging
  • Basic Cushioning: Midsole support adequate but not exceptional for long distances
  • Grip Limitations: Performance on smooth wet rocks is moderate
  • Size Variations: Fit consistency can vary between different production batches
  • No Warranty: Limited after-sale support compared to premium brands

The most significant advantage of crivit walking boots lies in their exceptional value proposition. For under £20, they deliver features and performance that would typically cost £60-80 from mainstream hiking brands. This makes them particularly attractive for families, occasional hikers, or those testing their interest in outdoor activities without major financial commitment.

However, potential buyers should understand the trade-offs inherent in budget outdoor footwear. While the boots perform admirably for their price point, they lack some advanced features found in premium alternatives. The cushioning system, while adequate, doesn't provide the same level of comfort for extended backpacking trips that you'd expect from specialized hiking boots.

For hikers seeking alternatives in the budget category, our guides to feminine walking boots and modern walking boots provide additional options to consider alongside Crivit models.

Where to Buy and Pricing

Primary Retail Channels

The primary source for crivit walking boots remains Lidl stores during special outdoor gear promotions. These typically occur during spring and autumn seasons, aligning with peak hiking periods. Lidl's "Special Buys" program introduces outdoor equipment for limited periods, usually lasting one to two weeks while stocks remain available.

Online Availability and Pricing

Amazon UK represents the most reliable online source for Crivit boots, often carrying various sizes and color options. Current pricing on Amazon typically ranges from £27.99 to £45.00, depending on size availability and seasonal demand. The platform's customer review system provides valuable insights from verified purchasers, helping potential buyers make informed decisions.

Recommended Purchase Options

Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Hiking Boot

Premium alternative with excellent waterproofing

$65.25 View on Amazon
Women's Waterproof Hiking Boots Outdoor Trekking

Similar price point with excellent user reviews

$45.99 View on Amazon
Women's Dimo Mid Waterproof Outdoor Hiking Boot

Mid-range option with superior support

$55.99 View on Amazon
Women's Terradora 2 Waterproof Low Height Hiking Shoes

Lightweight option for day hiking

$76.38 View on Amazon

Secondary Market Options

eBay and other resale platforms occasionally feature both new and gently used crivit walking boots. These can offer opportunities to find discontinued models or secure boots at below retail prices. However, buyers should exercise caution regarding sizing and condition, as return policies may be more restrictive than traditional retail channels.

For those exploring other affordable hiking boot options, consider reading our comprehensive guides about skecher walking boots and oex walking boots as alternatives in similar price ranges.

User Reviews and Real-World Performance

Amazon Review

Sarah M. - Lake District Hiker

"Purchased these crivit walking boots for weekend hiking and have been pleasantly surprised. Completed a 15-mile Lakeland fell walk in mixed conditions - feet stayed dry and comfortable throughout. The price point makes them perfect for occasional hikers like myself. Minor wear after 6 months of regular use, but overall excellent value."

Reddit Review

u/TrailExplorer99

"Used Crivit boots for a year of casual hiking. They're decent for the price but started showing wear on the sole after about 300 miles. Waterproofing held up well, though breathability could be better on hot days. Good entry-level boots but you get what you pay for in terms of longevity."

Quora Review

Mountain Guide Mike

"Recommended these to budget-conscious clients starting their hiking journey. Multiple customers have reported positive experiences with day hiking and short backpacking trips. The boots provide adequate support and weather protection for their price category. Not suitable for technical terrain, but excellent for footpath hiking and moderate hill walking."

Performance Analysis from Extended Use

Analyzing feedback from multiple sources reveals consistent patterns in crivit walking boots performance. Users consistently praise the initial comfort and minimal break-in period required. The waterproof capabilities receive positive mentions across various reviews, with most users reporting effective moisture protection during typical hiking conditions.

Durability feedback shows mixed results depending on usage patterns. Casual hikers completing 2-4 walks monthly report satisfaction with boot longevity, often achieving 12-18 months of regular use. However, more intensive users hiking multiple times weekly note accelerated wear patterns, particularly on the outsole and toe reinforcement areas.

The grip performance receives moderate ratings from users, with most finding traction adequate for typical hiking surfaces. Several reviews mention decreased confidence on wet rocks and steep grassy slopes, consistent with my own testing experience. Users hiking primarily on established paths and moderate terrain report higher satisfaction levels than those tackling technical routes.

For those considering boots designed for specific hiking styles, our specialized guides to fell walking boots and hiking boots for walking provide detailed comparisons with other options suited for particular terrain types and hiking styles.

Frequently Asked Questions

Are Crivit walking boots waterproof?

Yes, most crivit walking boots feature waterproof technology with TEX membrane construction. This integrated membrane provides water resistance while maintaining breathability. However, the level of waterproofing varies between models, with some offering basic water resistance and others providing more robust protection suitable for wet conditions and stream crossings. During my testing, the waterproof performance proved reliable for typical hiking conditions, though extended exposure to heavy rain or deep puddles may eventually lead to moisture penetration.

How do Crivit walking boots compare to premium brands?

Crivit walking boots offer excellent value for money but lack some advanced features of premium brands. They provide adequate durability and comfort for casual hiking and day walks. However, premium brands typically offer superior materials, advanced cushioning systems, better ankle support, and longer warranties. For occasional hikers, Crivit boots represent a cost-effective entry point into outdoor footwear, while serious hikers might benefit from investing in higher-end alternatives for better long-term performance and specialized features.

Where can I buy Crivit walking boots?

Crivit walking boots are primarily available through Lidl stores and their online platform during special outdoor gear promotions. They can also be found on Amazon UK, eBay, and various second-hand marketplaces. Availability is often seasonal, with the best selection typically appearing during spring and autumn outdoor gear sales at Lidl stores across Europe. Online marketplaces offer more consistent availability but often at higher prices than direct Lidl purchases.

What sizes do Crivit walking boots come in?

Crivit walking boots are available in European sizing, typically ranging from EU 36 to EU 46, which covers UK sizes 3.5 to 11.5. The boots are designed with German shoe strips for optimal fit and come in both men's and women's specific models. Some unisex models are also available. It's recommended to try them on or carefully check size charts, as sizing can vary slightly between different Crivit models and production batches.

How long do Crivit walking boots typically last?

With moderate use, crivit walking boots typically last 1-2 years or approximately 300-500 miles of hiking. Their durability depends heavily on usage patterns and terrain. For casual day hiking and walking, they can provide excellent service for their price point. However, for intensive hiking or challenging terrain, users may experience faster wear on the sole and upper materials compared to premium hiking boots. Regular maintenance and appropriate care can extend their lifespan significantly.

Pro Tips for Crivit Boot Care

  • Waterproof Treatment: Apply DWR (Durable Water Repellent) treatment annually to maintain water resistance
  • Proper Drying: Remove insoles and allow boots to air dry completely after wet conditions
  • Regular Cleaning: Clean mud and debris promptly to prevent material degradation
  • Storage: Store in cool, dry conditions away from direct sunlight when not in use

Conclusion

After extensive testing and analysis, crivit walking boots represent an exceptional value proposition for budget-conscious outdoor enthusiasts. While they may not compete with premium hiking boots in terms of advanced features or long-term durability, they deliver surprisingly competent performance at a fraction of the cost of established brands.

These boots excel as entry-level hiking footwear, offering newcomers an affordable way to explore outdoor activities without significant financial commitment. The waterproof capabilities, comfortable fit, and reasonable durability make them suitable for day hiking, casual trekking, and moderate outdoor pursuits. For families introducing children to hiking or individuals testing their interest in outdoor activities, Crivit boots provide an excellent starting point.

However, serious hikers planning extensive backpacking trips, technical terrain exploration, or year-round mountain activities might find the limitations of budget construction restrict their outdoor ambitions. In such cases, investing in premium hiking boots with superior support, durability, and specialized features would provide better long-term value.

The seasonal availability through Lidl stores presents the primary challenge for potential buyers. Those interested in crivit walking boots should monitor Lidl's special offers and consider purchasing when available, given their attractive pricing. Alternative sources like Amazon UK provide more consistent availability but at higher price points that may reduce the value proposition.

Final Recommendation

I recommend crivit walking boots for:

  • Casual hikers exploring day walks and established paths
  • Budget-conscious families seeking affordable outdoor footwear
  • Beginners testing their interest in hiking activities
  • Experienced hikers seeking backup or alternative footwear
  • Those prioritizing value over premium features

For those seeking alternatives or wanting to explore other options in various price ranges, I encourage visiting our comprehensive guides to best hiking walking boots, walking hiking boots women's, and proper walking boots to make the most informed decision for your specific hiking needs and budget considerations.

Explore More Walking Boot Reviews
